description: Unique identifier for the integration configuration.
Business-friendly title used to identify the integration in user interfaces and logs.
Brief summary of the integration’s purpose and what data or processes it exchanges.
Reference to the integration category (e.g., import, export, event-driven); determines high-level behavior. Likely a foreign key; confirm with SME.
Reference to the source/target application family associated with this integration. Likely identifies endpoint system type; confirm with SME.
Reference indicating how the integration runs (manual, scheduled, real-time, batch). Likely a foreign key to execution modes; confirm with SME.
Reference to the error handling/notification method used when runs fail (e.g., log, email, queue). Likely a foreign key; confirm with SME.
Flag indicating whether errors encountered during execution are written to the system log.
Timestamp when this integration configuration was first created.
Identifier of the user or service account that created the configuration. Likely a foreign key; confirm with SME.
Timestamp of the most recent update to this configuration.
Identifier of the user or service account that last modified the configuration. Likely a foreign key; confirm with SME.
Application route or endpoint used to access or trigger the integration within the platform.
Location or route for configuring this integration’s settings; may be internal or external to the application.
Link or path to user or technical documentation describing how to configure and operate the integration.
Executable path or endpoint the scheduler/process uses to run the integration job.
Endpoint or file path where execution status or results can be queried. If empty, status may be available elsewhere; confirm with SME.
Optional reference to a fuel vendor associated with this integration, used for vendor-specific data exchanges. Likely a foreign key; confirm with SME.
Fully qualified application class that implements the integration logic used at runtime.
Flag indicating whether multiple instances of this integration may run in parallel.
